svg.font-family: SauceCodePro Nerd Font, Source Code Pro, Courier

g.text: Confirm the integrity of CDN URLs based on installed npm packages and update
their integrity attribute (HTML) and paths (JS or HTML).
Repeat for each file or file glob you wish to be
updated. Required. If ends in `.json`, the JSON
strategy will be used in place of the HTML
Path to config file for options. Lower priority
than other CLI options. Defaults to non-use.
Path(s) to which to save the file if different
Regular expression path(s) with named capturing
"min", and "ext", indicating how to find CDN URLs
and identify the name, version, path, and
extension portions. Defaults to an array of
Name of the CDN. Should be supplied in the order
defaults to the detected installed version).
Defaults to a list of replacements (see source).
convert a CDN pattern to local `node_modules`.
Defaults to a list of replacements (see source).
Algorithms to enforce on all CDNs, whether
previously existing or not. Defaults to not
enforcing any besides updating the type(s) present
Use this for avoiding CDN base paths and writing
Use this for avoiding adding `integrity` when the
and JavaScript string checking for existence of
global before attempting to load local fallback
Avoid checking any config, including defaulting to
Path to `package.json` for discovery of its
checking for a `package.json` and just using the
regular CLI options. This option is ignored if
Current working directory path. Defaults to
`file` files will be treated by default as globs.
Set this to `true` to disable. This is
Whether to add `crossorigin` to all scripts and
`crossorigin`. Note that the empty string and
"anonymous" are equivalent in HTML. Defaults to
Maps npm package names to the CDN names of
`cdnName` so that when specific packages are
detected within CDN-ambiguous URL patterns, e.g.,
with local `node_modules` URLs, a particular CDN
can be forced for a particular package. Set to an
empty object to avoid package-specific overrides.
Options to pass to DomHandler. Defaults to none.
Options to pass to htmlparser2. Defaults to none.
parsing to a number, a number will be used.
(assumes targeted script file will be of the same
name as the ESM input, but resolving to a
Useful when source is intended to avoid a build
paths in source) but output is CDN-friendly UMD or
IIFE without the cascading HTTP requests of ESM.
Whether to drop `<base href>` in the output.
Useful when source is intended to work against
development files but the output file does not
Comment text to add at beginning of output HTML
Forces `integrity` checks even when the version
does not need to be changed. Defaults to `false`.
Set if you wish to confirm the CDN URL's contents
currently match the expected hash. Defaults to
Avoids sending requests to confirm that the new
URL can be successfully resolved. Defaults to
